newsitem.title: GREECE: BZW, Sanwa set a $113 mln facility for Greek bank.
newsitem.headline: BZW, Sanwa set a $113 mln facility for Greek bank.

text.p: The following information on a structured sale and repurchase facility for the National Mortgage Bank of Greece was provided by arrangers BZW and the Sanwa Bank, Limited.

The facility of up to $113 million consists of three tranches, each being in respect of a specific bond series, and has an overall maturity of 4.0 years and two months and an average maturity of 3.1 years.
The bonds to be purchased have been issued by the Hellenic Republic and are denominated in Greek drachmas.
Barclays Bank will provide a swap to complete the transaction and it will be risk managed by Barclays' Athens branch.
The proceeds will be used by the National Mortgage Bank of Greece for liquidity purposes.
